title: Patagonia: Billionaire boss of fashion retailer gives company away
description: Yvon Chouinard will give all of the fashion company's profits to a charity fighting climate change.

title: The Papers: 'Nation says farewell' in 'the long goodbye'
description: The front pages focus on the Queen's coffin being taken to Westminster Hall where the public are paying their respects.

title: Adnan Syed: Prosecutors seek new trial in Serial podcast case
description: A Baltimore prosecutor says an investigation of the case now points to two other possible suspects.

title: Ukraine's President Zelensky involved in car accident
description: A passenger car collided with the Ukrainian president's vehicle in Kyiv, a spokesman says.

title: Pakistan floods: Dengue cases soaring after record monsoon
description: Health officials warn of a looming crisis as deaths from dengue and other diseases rise by the day.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Hong Kong's grief sends message to Beijing
description: The display of affection is also a way to express unhappiness at the situation in the former colony.

title: Man City 2-1 Borussia Dortmund: The night Erling Haaland emulated Cruyff in Champions League
description: Manchester City beat Borussia Dortmund thanks to a sensational goal from Erling Haaland - one reminiscent of Johan Cruyff

title: R. Kelly: Disgraced R&B star guilty of child abuse
description: The sex offender is convicted on six out of 13 counts after a four-week trial in Chicago.

title: Kwasi Kwarteng considers scrapping bankers’ bonus cap to boost City
description: The new chancellor believes removing a cap on bankers' bonuses could boost growth in the City.

title: Shakhtar Donetsk 1-1 Celtic: Is there more to come in Champions League for Celtic?
description: Celtic just have a point from their first two Champions League games, but is there more to come from them?

title: Manchester City 2-1 Borussia Dortmund: Erling Haaland scores winner as hosts come from behind
description: Erling Haaland scores winner as Man City come from behind to beat Borussia Dortmund in Champions League.

title: Chelsea 1-1 FC Red Bull Salzburg: Hosts held to draw on Potter's first outing as manager
description: Graham Potter begins his Chelsea reign with a draw against RB Salzburg, which leaves his side with an uphill task to qualify for the Champions League knockout stages.

title: Rangers 0-3 Napoli: Serie A leaders claim victory against 10-man hosts
description: Ten-man Rangers fall to their third straight heavy defeat despite a more encouraging performance against Napoli on a dramatic night in the Champions League.

title: England 73-7 Wales: Red Roses win world record 25th consecutive Test
description: England become the first team in history to win 25 Tests in a row as they finish their World Cup preparations with an 11-try win against Wales at Bristol's Ashton Gate.

title: Citi offers junior bankers sun with Malaga office
description: The US investment bank has opened a new office on the Costa del Sol to help recruit junior staff.

title: Magdalena Andersson: Swedish PM resigns as right-wing parties win vote
description: The nation's first elected female leader is narrowly defeated in a major shift for Sweden.

title: Round-up: Zelensky in freed city, while Scholz says Putin remains undaunted
description: Ukraine's president visits Izyum - while the German chancellor says President Putin does not think the invasion was a mistake.

title: Rangers play national anthem before Napoli game; no silence in Poland for Celtic
description: Rangers play the national anthem and hold a minute's silence before their Champions League tie with Napoli to mark the death of Queen Elizabeth.

title: Lying-in-state: The dazzling crown resting on top of the Queen’s coffin
description: What’s the story behind the most iconic item in the Crown Jewels?

title: Shakhtar Donetsk 1-1 Celtic: Scottish champions held in Warsaw by Ukrainians
description: Celtic endure a frustrating night as a resolute Shakhtar Donetsk side hold them to a Champions League draw in Warsaw.

title: Police take to rooftops and manholes ahead of funeral for massive security operation
description: As emperors, kings, queens and presidents descend on London, police have embarked on a huge operation.

title: Davis Cup: Great Britain trail United States 1-0 in opening group tie
description: Dan Evans narrowly loses to Tommy Paul to leave Great Britain trailing the United States 1-0 after the opening singles match of their Davis Cup group tie.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: First night trains for mourners set to depart
description: Night services will start on Wednesday after a busy day on London's trains and tubes.

title: Lying-in-state: Viewing Queen's coffin 'gave me such pride'
description: Mourners speak of seeing the Queen lying in state, as thousands more wait to pay their respects.

title: Armenia says 105 troops killed in Azerbaijan border clashes
description: World leaders are intensifying diplomatic efforts to stop a full-blown war.

title: Ukraine war: Olaf Scholz says Vladimir Putin does not see war as mistake
description: The German chancellor spoke to the Russian president on the phone on Tuesday.

title: Watch: How Queen Elizabeth's journey to lying-in-state unfolded
description: Queen Elizabeth's coffin is brought to Parliament to lie in state, so the public can pay their respects.

title: Center Parcs: Further backlash against closure plan
description: Guests already on holiday can now stay on site but will not be able to use facilities.

title: France must reconsider ban on IS members' return
description: The decision could create a political headache for a number of European governments.

title: YouTuber guilty of Oval pitch invasion during England game
description: Daniel Jarvis ran into England batter Jonny Bairstow after entering the field during a Test.

title: Ashley Dale: Murder arrests over woman shot in back garden
description: Three men are held on suspicion of murdering 28-year-old Ashley Dale in Liverpool.

title: Asda limits sales of Just Essentials budget range
description: The supermarket temporarily limits purchases in its Just Essentials range, blaming soaring demand.

title: In Pictures: Royals follow Queen on sombre final journey
description: Royals follow in procession as Queen Elizabeth II leaves Buckingham Palace for the last time.

title: Premier League: Minute's silence and national anthem part of tributes to Queen
description: All Premier League matches will begin with a minute's silence this weekend as part of tributes to the Queen.

title: Brendon McCullum: James Anderson and Stuart Broad will be selected in England’s 2023 Ashes squad
description: England’s all-time leading Test wicket-takers James Anderson and Stuart Broad will be selected for the Ashes series against Australia next year, says head coach Brendon McCullum.

title: Queen Elizabeth II leaves Buckingham Palace for the final time
description: Queen Elizabeth II leaves Buckingham Palace for the final time as her coffin makes its way to Westminster Hall.

title: Ukraine war: President Zelensky visits city recaptured in rapid counter-offensive
description: Kyiv's troops are targeting towns in the Donbas region, the main focus of Russia's invasion.

title: William and Harry side by side behind Queen's coffin
description: King Charles, Prince William and Prince Harry walk in procession together in a symbol of family unity.

title: BBC to stream Queen Elizabeth II lying in state
description: The global streaming is for those wanting to pay their respects but are unable to travel to London.

title: McDonald's to close for Queen's funeral on Monday
description: The fast food chain will shut all its restaurants until 5pm on 19 September.

title: New Hampshire primary race too close to call as Don Bolduc holds narrow lead
description: Republicans hope the race could be their path to winning back control of the Senate in November.

title: Gavi: Midfielder signs new Barcelona contract until 2026 with 1bn euros release clause
description: Spain midfielder Gavi signs a new contract with Barcelona until 2026 with a 1bn euros (£865m) release clause.

title: Lyra McKee: Niall Sheerin jailed for having gun used to kill journalist
description: Niall Sheerin was an associate of a "serious terrorist gang", says the judge at a court in Belfast.

title: Camping overnight to see Queen's lying-in-state
description: Hundreds of people braved wet weather to be among the first people to see the Queen's coffin.

title: Queen's funeral: Routine hospital care being postponed
description: Appointments, including for surgery and outpatient clinics, rescheduled because of Queen's funeral.

title: London Marathon allows mass-participation runners to define as non-binary
description: People entering next year's London Marathon mass participation event will be able to register as non-binary, rather than male or female.

title: Ukraine war: EU moves to cut peak electricity use by 5%
description: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen also calls for windfall taxes on energy companies in a keynote speech.

title: In Pictures: The people waiting to pay respects
description: Large queues are forming in London, as people wait for the Queen's lying-in-state to begin

title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp unimpressed with Todd Boehly's 'All-Star Premier League game' idea
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp is left non-plussed by new Chelsea owner Todd Boehly's idea of an US style All-Star game in the Premier League.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Reward of £50k offered in hunt for girl's killer
description: The money has been put up for information leading to the conviction of Olivia Pratt-Korbel's killer.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Flight carrying coffin most tracked plane in history
description: Nearly six million people tried to follow the plane's route, causing the Flightradar24 site to crash.

title: WATCH: Leaking pen bothers King Charles III at signing
description: The King was signing a book at Hillsborough Castle, a royal residence in Northern Ireland.

title: Danny Schofield: Huddersfield Town sack head coach after nine games
description: Huddersfield Town sack head coach Danny Schofield after just one win from his nine games in charge.

title: Claire Foy: The Crown actress 'honoured' to have played the Queen
description: The Crown actress says the late monarch was "a massive symbol of continuity and dignity and grace".

title: Robert Sarver: Suns owner suspended and fined $10m for misconduct
description: Robert Sarver, owner of the Phoenix Suns, is suspended for a year and fined $10m after an NBA investigation into claims of workplace racism and misogyny.

title: UK inflation rate eases but still near 40-year high
description: Price rises slow slightly in August but the pace of inflation is still near a 40-year high.

title: Iowa teen who killed alleged rapist sentenced and fined
description: Pieper Lewis, now 17, is put on probation for five years over the deadly stabbing in Iowa in 2020.

title: Queen lying in state: Queuing through the night to 'say hello and goodbye'
description: People are queuing through the night for the chance to walk past the Queen's coffin in Westminster.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Woolly postbox topper tributes appear across England
description: The Royal Mail says it admires the "creativity" that has gone into producing the toppers.

title: Welsh breeder's dog fathered Queen's corgi
description: A Welsh corgi breeder recalls a special appointment with the Queen to help with her pet project.
